intro: Nolana philippiana, commonly known as the Philippine nolana, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Nolana philippiana is often found in disturbed habitats and is of interest for its ornamental value and ecological role.
